isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - REMOVE - CONTROLLER

note.para: The CONTROLLER is mounted on the Relay Valve.

step1.para: Identify and remove all air lines connected to the unit.
Identify and disconnect the electrical connector(s) from the controller.

Note and mark the mounting position of the controller/relay valve assembly on the vehicle. Loosen, remove and save the mounting hardware attaching the controller/relay valve assembly bracket to the vehicle. Remove the controller/relay valve assembly from the vehicle.
Remove any contamination from the exterior of the assembly.

caution.para: Make sure to keep contamination away from the open ports.

step1.para: Note and mark the position of the controller relative to the antilock relay valve. Remove and retain the four capscrews that secure the controller to the antilock relay valve. Carefully separate the controller from the antilock relay valve making certain not to damage the gasket between the two components. Peel the gasket from the controller or relay valve and retain for reuse.

note.para: Use a new gasket if the old gasket is damaged or if a new gasket is readily available.
